actions.text: Lift the lid off the teapot.
Pour hot water from the kettle into the teapot.
Retrieve the teapot lid from where it was set aside.
Open the tea bag box.
Select and remove a tea bag from the box.
Tear the tea bag wrapper.
Hold the tea bag by the string.
Steep the tea bag in the hot water.
Release the tea bag.
Place the lid back onto the teapot.
Pour the tea into the teacup from the kettle.
Hold the box or bottle of cream securely.
Unscrew the cap of the cream container.
Pour the cream into the teacup containing the steeped tea.
Reseal the cream container by screwing the cap back on.
Unfasten the lid of the sugar canister.
Grasp the spoon securely.
Scoop a spoonful of sugar with a teaspoon from the sugar canister.
Add the sugar into the teacup.
Stir the tea, cream, and sugar together with the teaspoon until well mixed.
Set the teaspoon down on the clean surface.
Fasten the lid of the sugar canister back on.
Pick up a pre-cut lemon half and a citrus reamer.
Extract the juice by pressing and twisting the reamer into the lemon over the teacup.
Put down the lemon and citrus reamer once sufficient juice is extracted.
Lift the teacup carefully by its handle.
Take a small, careful sip of the tea.
Repeat sipping the tea twice.
Lower the teacup back onto the saucer or table gently.
Pick up a piece of kitchen towel.
Wipe the teaspoon, teacup, and other used utensils with the kitchen towel.
Discard the used kitchen towel into the trash can.

scenes.scene_name: Making, Eating and Cleaning Instant Noodle

actions.text: Unseal the instant noodle container by tearing the lid halfway off.
Remove the veggie bag and oil packet from the container and put them on the table.
Pick up the veggie bag.
Tear open the veggie bag by pulling apart the wrapper.
Empty the veggie contents into the noodle container by shaking the bag.
Trash the empty veggie bag into the trash can.
Pinch the oil packet.
Tear open the oil packet by pulling apart the wrapper.
Squeeze the oil into the noodle container.
Dispose the empty oil packet into the trash can.
Pull the tissue upwards out of the tissue box.
Wipe the oil off your fingers with the tissue.
Throw away the used tissue into the trash can.
Pour hot water into the noodle container up to the fill line.
Reseal the container lid to trap the heat.
Hover your hand over the container to feel the temperature.
Wait for the noodles to cook for the recommended time.
Tear the lid off the noodle container.
Dispose the noodle container lid to the trash can.
Grab the fork
Submerge any floating noodles into the soup with the fork.
Untangle the noodles with the fork.
Stir the fork to further untangle the noodles.
Twirl the noodles on the fork.
Deliver the noodles to your mouth with the fork and eat.
Shake off any remaining noodles back into the bowl
Put the fork down on the table.
Grasp the disposable chopstick wrapper with one hand.
Tear open the wrapper by pulling apart the sealed edges.
Slide the chopsticks from the wrapper.
Hold the chopsticks together in one hand.
Split the chopsticks apart by gently pulling them in opposite directions.
Hold the chopsticks in one hand to prepare for eating noodles.
Lift the noodles with the chopsticks.
Split any entangled noodles with the chopsticks.
Dip the noodles back into the soup to absorb more flavor.
Deliver the noodles to your mouth with the chopsticks and eat.
Drop any remaining noodles on the chopsticks back into the container.
Put the chopsticks back on the table.
Hold the spoon.
Swirl the spoon in the noodle soup to cool it slightly.
Skim off excess oil from the soup with the spoon.
Dispose the skimmed oil to the trash can.
Spoon some noodle soup into the spoon.
Carry the soup to your mouth with the spoon and drink.
Put the spoon down on the table.
Hold the ramen container securely with two hands.
Tilt the container to sip the remaining soup directly.
Put the container back on the table.
Tear off a piece of kitchen towel.
Wipe the chopsticks with the kitchen towel.
Clean the spoon with the kitchen towel.
Dry the fork with the kitchen towel.
Discard the used kitchen towels into the trash can.
Empty the remaining contents of the container into the trash can.
Tie the trash bag closed.
Open the paper bag by separating the top flaps.
Take out all the food items and utensils from the bag.
Reposition the utensils in front of you.
Set up the food items in a reachable area.
Uncap the hand sanitizer bottle.
Apply a generous amount of sanitizer to your dominant hand.
Cap the hand sanitizer bottle.
Put the sanitizer bottle down on the table.
Rub your hands together to sanitize them thoroughly.
Hold the can of soda.
Pull the ring tab to open the soda can.
Insert a straw into the soda can.
Drink from the soda with the straw.
Put the soda can down.
Unwrap the burger and set the paper wrapper aside.
Deliver the burger to your mouth and take one or several bites.
Put the burger back on the plate.
Squeeze some ketchup out from the ketchup bottle onto the plate.
Grip a fry with your fingers.
Dip the fry into the ketchup.
Deliver the fry to your mouth and eat it.
Sprinkle any remaining salt on your fingers over the plate.
Peel off the lid of the dipping sauce container.
Grasp a piece of fried chicken thigh.
Dip the fried chicken thigh into the dipping sauce.
Rotate the chicken thigh as you eat it to get all sides.
Pick up one piece of napkin.
Unfold the napkin.
Wipe any crumbs or spills off the table with a napkin.
Scrunch the napkin into a ball.
Drop the napkin ball into the trash can.
Grasp the jar containing the pudding.
Pinch the rubber band around the pudding jar.
Stretch the rubber band and slide it off the jar.
Remove the cloth covering the jar to reveal the pudding.
Hold the pudding jar over a plate.
Invert the pudding jar to dump the pudding onto the plate.
Shake the jar to ensure all the pudding is transferred to the plate.
Scoop with a spoon to ensure all the puddings are transferred.
Put down the pudding jar.
Grip the pudding spoon.
Scoop a piece of pudding.
Deliver the pudding to your mouth and eat it.
Put down the pudding spoon.
Cover the remaining pudding with the pudding jar.
Flip the pudding jar and plate to transfer the remaining pudding back into the jar.
Lift the piece of cloth off the table.
Cover the pudding jar with the cloth.
Grip the rubber band.
Bind the pudding jar with the rubber band.
Put the pudding jar back on the table.
Gather the remaining chicken thigh and fries back into the food box.
Wrap the remaining burger with the paper wrapper.
Close the burger box.

activities.activity_name: Cleaning Up Drink and Food Items

actions.text: Pull out the straw from the soda can.
Wedge the used straw into the soda can opening.
Gather the remaining food items and place them back into the paper bag.
Fold the top of the paper bag to close it.
Clean your hands with hand sanitizer.

scenes.scene_name: Making an open egg and spam sandwich.

actions.text: Untwist the metal twist tie to unseal the bread bag.
Take out a slice of bread.
Twist the metal twist tie to reseal the bread bag.
Insert the bread slice into the toaster.
Tune the temperature of the toaster by rotating the knob to the highest degree.
Press the toaster lever to start toasting the bread.
Place the toasted bread on a plate.
Unscrew the lid of the peanut butter jar.
Take out a butter knife from the knife holder.
Insert the butter knife into the peanut butter jar.
Try to spread the peanut butter evenly on the toasted bread.
Wipe the jam spatula clean with a kitchen towel.
Insert the butter knife back into the knife holder.
Grasp the can of spam on the table.
Tear off the lid of the spam can to reveal the contents.
Lift the spam can above the cutting board.
Upturn the spam can to release the spam onto the cutting board.
Knock the bottom of the can to ensure the spam is fully released.
Grip a knife and fork.
Thrust the fork into the spam to stabilize it.
Slice the spam into even pieces.
Detach the fork from the last slice of spam.
Unwrap a piece of butter.
Grasp the butter knife.
Slice a piece of butter with the knife.
Place a pan on the stove.
Pretend to switch on the stove.
Adding the butter to the pan.
Spread the butter on the pan to melt it.
Put down the butter knife.
Take out a pair of tongs from the utensil holder.
Pick up a piece of spam using the tongs.
Transfer the spam to the pan with the tongs to fry.
Flip the spam with the tongs to ensure both sides are cooked.
Stack the fried spam on top of the bread.
Open the egg carton.
Take out an egg from the carton.
Move a bowl to be in front of you.
Crack the egg by tapping it against the edge of the bowl and split the shell.
Discard the eggshells into the trash can.
Close the egg carton.
Rotate the pepper grinder to add black pepper to the egg.
Shake the salt container to add salt to the egg.
Beat the egg in the bowl with a fork, blending the yolk and white thoroughly.
Pour the beaten egg into the heated pan.
Grasp a spatula.
Scramble the egg by moving the spatula around the pan.
Poke the egg with the spatula to test if it's cooked.
Stir-fry the egg.
Slide the cooked egg on top of the stacked bread and spam.
Put down the spatula.
Switch off the stove.
Turn the faucet on.
Thoroughly wash the lettuce leaves under the faucet.
Rinse the apple under running water.
Turn the faucet off.
Peel the lettuce leaves one by one, placing them into a bowl.
Soak the lettuce in a bowl of cold water.
Drain the lettuce leaves in a colander.
Gently shrink the lettuce leaves with your hands to wring out the water.
Tear the lettuce leaves into square pieces .
Unsheathe a fruit knife.
Shred the lettuce leaves into smaller pieces with the knife.
Tilt the chopping board to transfer the shredded lettuce to the salad bowl.
Strip a banana of its peel.
Lay the banana on the chopping board.
Slice the banana into three pieces.
Transfer the sliced banana into the salad bowl.
Peel the apple with a peeler.
Place the apple on the chopping board.
Pick up the knife.
Chop the apple into halves.
Cut the apple into smaller segments.
Dice the apple into smaller pieces.
Mince the apple pieces into small dice sizes.
Squash the apple dice with the flat side of the knife.
Scrape the squashed apple from the chopping board into the salad bowl.
Put down the knife.
Unzip the zipped bag with nuts
Take out nuts from the bag and place them on the chopping board.
Zip the bag closed.
Crush the nuts with the flat side of the knife.
Sweep the crushed nuts from the chopping board into the mortar.
Pick up the pestle.
Mash the nuts with a pestle.
Grind the mashed nuts into smaller chunks.
Pound the ground nuts into a fine consistency with the mortar pounder.
Put down the pestle.
Grate cheese with a cheese grater.
Pick two grapes from the bunk and drop them into the salad bowl.
In a large salad bowl, combine all the chopped ingredients. Use clean hands to toss the ingredients gently.
Drizzle the dressing over the salad.
Toss the salad in the bowl to coat all the ingredients thoroughly with the dressing.
Spear a variety of ingredients with a fork and bring them to your mouth to eat.
Scrape any leftover salad from the bowl into the trash can.
Clear the table by disposing of any remaining food.
Mop the table surface with a damp cloth or mop.
Dry your hands with a hand towel.
Stack the sieve on top of a bowl.
Pour the flour into the sieve.
Gently shake the sieve to sift the remaining flour.
Tap the edge of the sieve to allow the flour to fall evenly into the bowl.
Remove the sieve from the bowl.
Uncap a bottle of water.
Use a measuring cup to measure a cup of water.
Cap the water bottle.
Pour the water into the mixing bowl.
Scoop a ¼ spoonful of yeast.
Add the yeast to the mixing bowl.
Stir the ingredients with a spatula.
Beat the mixture with the spatula, using vigorous circular hand motions to fully incorporate air and blend the ingredients smoothly.
Pinch some extra flour from the flour bag.
Gently scatter the extra flour on the chopping board.
Move the dough to the floured chopping board.
Scrape down the sides of the mixing bowl with a dough scraper to gather the dough.
Knead the dough on the floured surface.
Push the dough with the heels of your hands into a flat shape.
Fold the dough over itself.
Repeat this push and fold motion 5 times.
Gently pat the dough to even out the surface and remove any air pockets.
Stretch and fold the dough to help develop structure and trap air bubbles.
Lift the stretched dough from one side.
Fold the lifted dough over to the opposite side.
Widen the dough by gently stretching it with both hands.
Divide the dough into two portions.
Shape the first portion into a roll.
Roll the dough into a pancake shape with a rolling pin.
Mold the pancake into a straw shape by rolling the pancake.
Crimp the ends of the straw to seal them and add texture.
Transfer the first portion to the baking tray.
Tuck the edges of the second portion to form smooth, tight shapes.
Score the surface of the dough with shallow cuts using a sharp knife.
Compress the second portion into the empty container.
Switch on the oven.
Open the oven door.
Stick a hand into the oven to check the temperature.
Transfer the baking tray into the oven.
Shut the oven door.
Open the oven door.
Wear oven mitts.
Pull out the baking tray from the oven.
Shut the oven door.
Tap the bottom of the loaf to check for doneness.
Waving your hands around the loaves for even cooling.
Grasp a knife for sawing.
Saw a small piece off the bread with the sawing knife.
Place the bread on a rotating cake stand.
Rotate the cake stand to ensure it moves smoothly.
Apply a layer of frosting on the top of the bread with the piping bag.
Hold a spatula for spreading frosting.
Spread frosting along the sides of the bread.
Turn the cake stand while spreading as needed for even coverage.
Smooth the frosting on the bread's surface with the spatula.
Put down the spatula.
Grip the piping bag.
Squeeze the piping bag to add circular decorations.
Squeeze the piping bag to add wave-like decorations.
Put down the piping bag.
